Class MovieReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • MovieReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ReaderWriterInterface

    public class MovieReader
extends java.lang.Object
implements ReaderWriterInterface
    Author:
    evogl The MovieReader contains all methods regarding the Movie File for reading and writing

      • readFile

        public java.util.ArrayList<Movies> readFile()
                                     throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                                            java.io.IOException
        The method readFile(String path) reads a file and returns it to an Arraylist for the Movies
        Returns:
        arraylist from file which has to be created by splitting the lines
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the file could not be read
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - in case the file contains a String instead of number for oscar and year

      • findinFile

        public boolean findinFile(java.lang.String find)
        The method findinFile searches a String in the file and checks if it has been founded.
        Specified by:
        findinFile in interface ReaderWriterInterface
        Parameters:
        find - entered String which has to be found in the file
        Returns:
        checks if the string has been found and returns true, otherwise false
